title: Strange Things Happen: A Life with The Police, Polo, and Pygmies
description: “An excellent read.” — St. Petersburg Times   “An often hilarious, always candid and astutely observed memoir chronicling a life observed, largely, from the vantage point of a drum throne.” — Buffalo News   Rock legend Stewart Copeland, drummer for seminal pop trio The Police, shares his stories from before, during, and after his days with Sting and Andy Summers, in one of the most popular and influential bands of the eighties. Strange Things Happen indeed.
author: Stewart Copeland
